CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 31, 1970, pg. 6 reads: "Memorial To Founder - On a recent Sunday afternoon, the current pastor and members of Christian Tabernacle Kodesh Church of Immanuel, Centre Ave., Pittsburgh, broke ground for the erection of the John Walter Harty Memorial Building, which will be a memorial to a former pastor, who was also founder of the Harty Bible Schools. Leaders who participated in the actual groundbreaking are, left to right, James H. Wooling, chairman of the trustee board; the Rev. Clarence L. Jefferson, leader of the responsive reading; the Rev. Ellsworth Holmes, present pastor and James W. Lockhart, chairman of the building fund.  The new structure will replace the J.W. Harty Fellowship Hall, recently demolished, immediately adjacent to the church. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: James H. Wooling, Rev. Clarence L. Jefferson, Rev. Ellsworth Holmes, and James W. Lockhart, posed during groundbreaking ceremony for the John Walter Harty Memorial Building at the Christian Tabernacle Church, Centre Avenue
CatSubject_tab: Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Construction and demolition debris--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Centre Avenue (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Clergy--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Ceremonies and celebrations--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
